entry.title: OS-王道考研-1
entry.content:
概念、功能和目标

操作系统(Operating System, OS)是指控制和管理整个计算机系统的硬件和软件资源，并合理地组织调度计算机的工作和资源的分配，以提供给用户和其他软件方便的接口和环境，它是计算机系统中最基本的系统软件。

功能和目标

作为系统资源的管理者

作为用户和计算机硬件之间的接口

用户接口

  • 命令接口（允许用户直接使用）

    • 联机命令接口：用户说一句，系统做一句（=交互式命令接口）

    • 脱机命令接口：用户说一堆，系统做一堆（=批处理命令接口 .bat）

  • 程序接口（允许用户通过程序间接使用）：由一组系统调用组成（程序接口=系统调用）

    如C: Windows\System32\user32.dll，程序员在程序中调用user32.dll（该调用过程即为系统调用）即可实现创建窗口等功能。只能通过用户程序间接使用。

  • GUl（现代操作系统中最流行的图形用户接口）

易懵概念：系统调用=系统调用命令=广义指令

作为最接近硬件的层次

实现对硬件机器的拓展

没有任何软件支持的计算机称为裸机

通常把覆盖了软件的机器成为扩充机器，又称之为虚拟机

操作系统的特征

并发

并发：指两个或多个事件在同一时间间隔内发生。这些事件宏观上是同时发生的，但微观上是交替发生的。

常考易混概念一一并行：指两个或多个事件在同一时刻同时发生。

操作系统的并发性指计算机系统中同时存在着多个运行着的程序。

事实上，操作系统就是伴随着“多道程序技术”而出现的。因此，操作系统和程序并发是一起诞生的。

共享

共享即资源共享，是指系统中的资源可供内存中多个并发执行的进程共同使用。

扬声器在微观上也可以同时

虚拟

虚拟是指把一个物理上的实体变为若干个逻辑上的对应物。物理实体（前者）是实际存在的，而逻辑上对应物（后者）是用户感受到的。

比如

  • 虚拟存储器技术（虚拟技术中的“空分复用技术”）

  • 虚拟处理器技术（虚拟技术中的“时分复用技术”。微观上处理机在各个微小的时间段内交替着为各个进程服务）

异步

异步是指，在多道程序环境下，允许多个程序并发执行，但由于资源有限，进程的执行不是一贯到底的，而是走走停停，以不可预知的速度向前推进，这就是进程的异步性。

发展与分类

手工操作阶段

主要缺点：用户独占全机、人机速度矛盾导致资源利用率极低

批处理阶段

单道批处理系统

引入脱机输入/输出技术（用磁带完成），并监督程序负责控制作业的输入、输出

主要优点：缓解了一定程度的人机速度矛盾，资源利用率有所提升。
主要缺点：内存中仅能有一道程序运行，只有该程序运行结束之后才能调入下一道程序。CPU有大量的时间是在空闲等待I/O完成。资源利用率依然很低。

多道批处理系统

主要优点：多道程序并发执行，共享计算机资源。资源利用率大幅提升，CPU和其他资源保持“忙碌”状态，系统吞吐量增大
主要缺点：用户响应时间长，没有人机交互功能（用户提交自己的作业之后就只能等待计算机处理完成，中间不能控制自己的作业执行）

分时操作系统

计算机以时间片为单位轮流为各个用户/作业服务，各个用户可通过终端与计算机进行交互

主要优点：用户请求可以被即时响应，解决了人机交互问题。允许多个用户同时使用一台计算机，并且用户对计算机的操作相互独立，感受不到别人的存在
主要缺点：不能优先处理一些紧急任务。操作系统对各个用户/作业都是完全公平的，循环地为每个用户/作业服务一个时间片，不区分任务的紧急性。

实时操作系统

主要优点：能够优先响应一些紧急任务，某些紧急任务不需时间片排队。

在实时操作系统的控制下，计算机系统接收到外部信号后及时进行处理，并且要在严格的时限内处理完事件。实时操作系统的主要特点是及时性和可靠性。

entry.title: 函数极限与连续性
entry.content:
一、函数极限

1. 邻域

开区间

一维的情形

邻域

$ U(x_0) $

δ邻域

去心δ邻域

极限相关

左、右δ邻域

二维的情形

区域

δ邻域
去心δ邻域
δ邻域的几何意义

$ U\left(P_{0}, \delta\right) $ 表示 $ x O y $ 平面上以点 $ P_{0}\left(x_{0}, y_{0}\right) $ 为中心, $ \delta>0 $ 为半径的圆的内部的点$ P(x, y) $ 的全体

邻域与区间（区域）

邻域通常表示“一个局部位置”，比如“点x0的δ邻域”，就可以称为“点x0的附近”。这个“附近”到底多远，既难以说明也没有必要说明。

2. 函数极限的定义

ε-δ语言：

$ \lim\limits_{x\rightarrow\infty}f(x)=A\Leftrightarrow\forall\varepsilon>0,\exist X>0, 当|x|>X时，有|f(x) - A|<\varepsilon $

左右极限都包括

函数极限存在的充要条件

$ \lim {x \rightarrow x{0}} f(x)=A \Leftrightarrow \lim {x \rightarrow x{0}^{-}} f(x)=A, $ 且 $ \lim {x \rightarrow x{0}^{+}} f(x)=A $

或

$ \lim {x \rightarrow x{0}} f(x)=A \Leftrightarrow f(x)=A+\alpha(x), \lim {x \rightarrow x{0}} \alpha(x)=0 $（脱帽法。这里不代表$f(x)=A$，之间有误差$α(x)$）

3. 函数极限的性质

唯一性
局部有界性
局部保号性

4. 极限运算规则

5. 夹逼准则

$ \lim [g(x)-\varphi(x)] $ 存在并不能说明 $ \lim g(x), \lim \varphi(x) $ 都存在，从而也不能保证 $ \lim f(x) $ 存在.

6. 洛必达法则

  1. $\frac{0}{0}$**或$\frac{\infin}{\infin}$**

  2. 分子分母都可导

  3. $ \lim _{x \rightarrow a} \frac{f^{\prime}(x)}{F^{\prime}(x)}\left(\right. $ 或 $ \left.\lim _{x \rightarrow \infty} \frac{f^{\prime}(x)}{F^{\prime}(x)}\right) $ 存在或无穷大

则$$\lim _ { x \rightarrow a } \frac { f ( x ) } { F ( x ) } = \lim _ { x \rightarrow a } \frac { f ^ { \prime } ( x ) } { F ^ { \prime } ( x ) } ( \lim _ { x \rightarrow \infty } \frac { f ( x ) } { F ( x ) } = \lim _ { x \rightarrow \infty } \frac { f ^ { \prime } ( x ) } { F ^ { \prime } ( x ) } )$$

右存在，则左存在；但左存在，并不意味着右一定存在

7. 泰勒公式

$$ o\left(x^{3}\right) $$：佩亚诺余项

奇（偶）函数，展开的都是奇（偶）函数

$e ^ { x }=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{x^n}{n!}$

entry.title: 软件项目管理笔记-2
entry.content:
第二节 - 软件项目初期工作

软件项目分类

定制软件往往需要签订合同，中小型公司常见（用户确定，定金等等）

定制型软件

招标过程
  • 确定招标方式
  • 确定招标程序
  • 拟定招标文件
  • 确定标底
  • 发布招标公告
投标过程
  1. 投标前期准备（研究招标公告，是否满足要求、可行性能否达到等）
  2. 编写投标书
  3. 开标
  4. 评标
  5. 定标
投标报价

策略

  • 盈利策略
  • 微利保本策略
  • 低价亏损策略

方法

  • 不平衡报价法
  • 可选方案报价法
  • 突然降价法
  • 保本从长计议法
标书写作

标书在很多招标中起关键作用

标书写的好坏往往对于整个投标工作取决定性作用，写标书的往往是公司的技术核心或商业核心

基本内容：

  • 粗略的需求分析（对用户的需求比较了解即可，太详细浪费成本）
  • 技术大致方案（让用户感觉到技术实力，又不能过分向外暴露）
  • 实施方案
  • 售后服务
  • 公司简介
  • 报价等

通用型软件

市场不确定，风险大

初期工作

立项管理流程分为三个阶段：“立项建议阶段”、“立项评审阶段”和“项目筹备阶段”

立项调查

立项建议小组开展，主要工作包括：

  1. 市场调查
  2. 政策调查
  3. 同类产品调查
  4. 竞争对手调查
  5. 用户调查
  6. 其他相关的调查
产品构思
  1. 待开发产品的主要功能
  2. 。。。的技术方案
  3. Make-or-Buy决策（确定哪些产品部件应当采购，外包开发或者自主研发）
  4. 开发计划
  5. 市场营销计划
  6. 其他相关计划
可行性分析（重点☆）

可行性分析有些场景下必要，有些没必要写

  1. 市场可行性分析
  2. 政策可行性分析
  3. 竞争实力可行性分析
  4. 技术可行性分析
  5. 时间和资源可行性分析
  6. 知识产权可行性分析
  7. 其他相关可行性分析

软件质量管理

1.软件质量的定义
2.软件产品质量与过程质量的关系？
3.在CMM体系中，可重复级与初始级的主要差别是什么？已定义级与可重复级的主要差别是什么？

概念

与软件产品满足规定的和隐含的需要的能力有关的特征或特性的组合（IEEE）

不同的角色（用户、开发人员、维护人员···）从不同的角度看待软件质量会有不同的要求和理解

内涵

软件需求是度量软件质量的基础，不能满足需求的软件就不具备质量

软件质量保证以遵循各种标准中定义的开发规则为基础

McCall质量模型（1979年）

Boehm质量模型

软件产品质量和过程质量

  • 产品质量控制
    • 被动性、个体性、后期性
    • 特点：同一需求，不同过程，不同质量
  • 过程质量控制
    • 主动性、系统性、前期性
    • 特点：不同需求，同一过程，相同质量

软件的过程管理控制主要强调软件开发过程的标准化、规范化，质量管理的模式化

软件质量保证

目标：

  • 通过适当的监控系统及其开发过程来保证软件质量
  • 确保软件及其开发过程与己定的标准和规程要求完全一致
  • 确保能及时发现产品、过程和标准的任何不足并提醒管理者注意，以便及时弥补

软件质量保证由专门的组织负责

软件评审

概念：

  • 软件评审又称软件技术评审或同行评审；
  • 软件评审是指由开发人员的同行在项目实施的各个阶段进行的有组织的軟件浏览、文档与代码审读活动，验证工作是否符合预定的标准；

作用：

  • 协功软件开发人员在早期找出工作的错误，降低修正错误的成本
  • 贝尔实验室的研究报告显示：在发现程序错误的成效方面软件评审是测试的20倍
软件测试

目的：发现软件的缺陷，而不能证明软件正确

软件缺陷的主要内容

  • 软件未达到产品说明书标明的功能；
  • 软件未达到产品说明书虽未指出但应达到的目标；
  • 软件功能超出了产品说明书指明的范围；
  • 软件界面与操作方式违反相关标准或习惯；
  • 软件出现了产品说明书声明不会出现的错误。
ISO9000:2000质量认证体系

ISO9000组成

  • 质量术语标准；
  • 一质量保证标准；
  • 质量管理标准；
  • 质量管理和质量保证标准的选用和实施指南；
  • 支持性技术标准。
CMM标准体系

软件过程成熟度是指一个软件过程被明确定义、管理、质量和控制的有效程度。

结构：

软件过程能力成熟度等级

初始级

  • 不具备稳定的软件开发与维护环境；

可重复级

  • 已建立管理软件项目的方针与配套措施；

已定义级

  • 已形成管理软件开发与维护活动的组织标准软件过程

已管理级

  • 已对软件产品与过程设置了定量的质量目标；

优化级（很难达到）

  • 组织通过预防缺陷、技术创新和更改过程等多种方式，不断提高项目的过程性能以持续改善组织的软件过程能力。
CMMI标准体系

entry.title: OS笔记-第二章-进程
entry.content:
进程（Process）

指在系统中能独立运行并作为资源分配的基本单位，它是由一组机器指令、数据和堆栈等组成的，是一个能独立运行的活动实体

戳我看定义👉

https://baike.baidu.com/item/%E8%BF%9B%E7%A8%8B/382503?fr=aladdin

狭义定义：进程是正在运行的程序的实例（an instance of a computer program that is being executed）

广义定义：进程是一个具有一定独立功能的程序关于某个数据集合的一次运行活动。它是操作系统动态执行的基本单元，在传统的操作系统中，进程既是基本的分配单元，也是基本的执行单元

程序的执行

  • 单道：顺序，只有在一个用户程序执行完成后，才允许装入另一个程序并执行
  • 多道：并发

分析程序的顺序和并发执行，并发的新特点造成程序概念不适用，导致引入进程

前驱图（Precedence Graph）

  • 描述进程之间执行先后顺序的工具
  • 有向无循环图，可记为DAG(Directed Acyclic Graph)
    • 结点： 程序段，进程，操作，语句（初始节点，终止节点）
    • 有向边：前驱关系（前驱，后继，直接，权）

Pi→Pj物理意义：Pi的执行必须在Pj开始前结束

有前驱关系→有时序要求→必顺序

无前驱关系→无时序要求→可并发

表示

进程Pi和Pj存在着前驱关系，可表示为(Pi, Pj)∈→或Pi→Pj

初始结点（Initial Node）：没有前驱的结点

终止结点（Final Node）：没有后继的结点

重量（Weight）：表示改结点所含有的程序量或程序的执行时间

不允许有循环，否则必然会产生不可能实现的前趋关系

程序顺序执行

特征：

① 顺序性：每一操作必须在下一个操作开始之前结束

② 封闭性：程序在封闭的环境下运行，即程序运行时独占全机资源

③ 可再现性：只要环境和初始条件相同，程序重复执行时都可获得相同的结果

程序的并发执行

特征：

① 间断性：程序执行的间断性

② 失去封闭性：程序环境失去了封闭性（其它程序可以改变一个程序环境中资源的状态）

③ 不可再现性：程序结果的不可再现性←失去封闭性

其中I代表输入操作，C代表计算操作，P为打印操作

进程的描述

程序并发执行的特征决定了通常的程序是不能参与并发执行的。为了能并发执行并加以描述和控制，引入了“进程”的概念。

定义：进程是程序实体的运行过程，是系统进行资源分配和调度的一个独立单位

进程和程序是两个截然不同的概念，除了进程具有程序所没有的PCB结构外，还具有下面一些特征：

（1）动态性：一次执行过程，由创建产生，调度执行，阻塞暂停，撤消消亡

（2）并发性：多个进程在一段时间内同时运行

（3）独立性：传统OS中，进程是独立的调度单位，运行单位，资源分配单位

（4）异步性：进程按各自独立的，不可预知的速度向前推进

（5）结构特征：进程=程序段+数据段+PCB（进程实体/进程映像）

进程与程序的区别

程序是进程的组成部分

1个程序对应多个进程，1个进程包含多个程序

进程

  • 动态
  • 存在是暂时的

程序

  • 静态
  • 存在是永久的

进程的基本状态及转换

进程的三种基本状态
  1. 就绪（Ready）状态
  2. 执行（Running）状态
  3. 阻塞（Block）状态

entry.title: OS笔记-第一章-引论
entry.content:
OS第一节

OS是一组能有效地组织和管理计算机硬件和软件资源，合理的对各类作业进行调度，以及方便用户使用的程序的集合

OS是现在计算机系统中最基本和最重要的系统软件

三种基本操作系统：多道批处理系统、分时系统和实时系统

1.2 操作系统的发展过程

三种基本操作系统

批处理系统有着高的资源利用率和系统吞吐量；分时系统能获得及时响应；实时系统具有实时特征

多道批处理系统

优点

  • 资源利用率高
    1. 引入多道批处理能使多道程序交替运行，以保持CPU处于忙碌状态
    2. 在内存中装入多道程序可提高内存的利用率
    3. 此外还可以提高I/O设备的利用率
  • 系统吞吐量大
    1. CPU和其它资源保持“忙碌”状态
    2. 仅当作业完成时或运行不下去时才进行切换，系统开销小

缺点

  • 平均周转时间长
    • 由于作业要排队依次进行处理，因而作业的周转时间较长，通常需几个小时，甚至几天
  • 无交互能力
    • 用户一旦把作业提交给系统后，直至作业完成，用户都不能与自己的作业进行交互，修改和调试程序极不方便

分时系统和实时系统

https://www.cnblogs.com/chester-cs/p/11723463.html

分时系统是指在一个系统中多个用户分时地使用同一台计算机； 实时系统是指计算机及时响应外部事件地请求并在规定时限内完成对该事件的处理，控制所有实时外设和实时任务协调一致地运行

主要区别有两点

  • 分时系统的目标是提供一种通用性很强的系统，有较强的交互能力；而实时系统则大都是具有特殊用途的专用系统，交互能力略差
  • 分时系统对响应时间虽有要求，但一般来说，响应时间由人所能承受的等待时间来确定；而实时系统对响应时间要求很高，一般由控制系统或信息处理磁头所能接受的延迟时间来决定

1.3 操作系统的基本特性

上面三种基本操作系统具有并发、共享、虚拟和异步四个基本特征

并发和共享是多用户（多任务）OS的两个最基本的特征

并行性：指两个或多个事件在同一时刻发生

并发性（Concurrence）：指两个或多个事件在同一时间间隔内发生

共享（Sharing）

  1. 互斥共享方式

    系统中的某些资源，如打印机、磁带机等，虽然可以提供给多个进程(线程)使用，但应规定在一段时间内，只允许一个进程访问该资源。为此，在系统中应建立一种机制，以保证多个进程对这类资源的互斥访问

    这种在一段时间内只允许一个进程访问的资源，称为临界资源

  2. 同时访问方式

    这里所谓的“同时”，在单处理机环境下是宏观意义上的，而在微观上，这些进程对该资源的访问是交替进行的

虚拟（Virtual）

在OS中，把通过某种技术将一个物理实体变为若干个逻辑上对应物的功能称为“虚拟”

  1. 时分复用技术
    • 虚拟处理机技术
    • 虚拟设备技术
  2. 空分复用技术
异步（Asynchronism）

1.4 操作系统的主要功能

在传统的OS中应具有处理机管理、存储器管理、设备管理和文件管理等基本功能。此外，为了方便用户使用OS，还需向用户提供方便的用户接口。

处理机管理功能

  1. 进程控制

  2. 进程同步

  3. 进程通信

  4. 调度

    • 作业调度（允许多个）
    • 进程调度（允许1个）

存储器管理功能

内存分配

主要任务：

(1) 为每道程序分配内存空间，使它们“各得其所”。

(2) 提高存储器的利用率，尽量减少不可用的内存空间(碎片)。

(3) 允许正在运行的程序申请附加的内存空间，以适应程序和数据动态增长的需要。

OS可采取静态和动态两种方式：

(1) 静态分配方式。每个作业的内存空间是在作业装入时确定的，在作业装入后的整个运行期间不允许该作业再申请新的内存空间，也不允许作业在内存中“移动”。

(2) 动态分配方式。每个作业所要求的基本内存空间虽然也是在装入时确定的，但允许作业在运行过程中继续申请新的附加内存空间，以适应程序和数据的动态增长，也允许作业在内存中“移动”。

内存保护

主要任务：

(1) 确保每道用户程序都仅在自己的内存空间内运行，彼此互不干扰。

(2) 绝不允许用户程序访问操作系统的程序和数据，也不允许用户程序转移到非共享的其它用户程序中去执行。

地址映射

将地址空间中的逻辑地址转换为内存空间中与之对应的物理地址。该功能应在硬件的支持下完成。

内存扩充

内存扩充是借助于虚拟存储技术，从逻辑上扩充内存容量，以便让更多的用户程序能并发运行。

为了能在逻辑上扩充内存，系统必须设置内存扩充机制(包含少量的硬件)，用于实现下述功能：(1) 请求调入功能。(2) 置换功能。

设备管理功能

主要任务：

(1) 完成用户进程提出的I/O请求，为用户进程分配所需的I/O设备，并完成指

定的I/O操作。

(2) 提高CPU和I/O设备的利用率，提高I/O速度，方便用户使用I/O设备。

为实现上述任务，设备管理应具有缓冲管理、设备分配和设备处理以及虚拟设备等功能。

文件管理功能

(1) 文件存储空间的管理

(2) 目录管理

(3) 文件的读/写管理和保护

操作系统与用户之间的接口

  1. 用户接口

    (1) 联机用户接口（键盘操作命令和命令解释程序）。
    (2) 脱机用户接口（批处理作业和作业说明书）。
    (3) 图形用户接口。

  2. 程序接口

    程序接口是为用户程序在执行中访问系统资源而设置的，是用户程序取得操作系统服务的唯一途径。

entry.title: OS_3 - 非连续内存分配
entry.content:
非连续内存分配

段用的比较少，主要用分页机制

连续内存分配的缺点

  • 分配给一个程序的物理内存是连续的
  • 内存利用率较低
  • 有外碎片、内碎片的问题

非连续分配的优点

  • 一个程序的物理地址空间是非连续的
  • 更好的内存利用和管理
  • 允许共享代码与数据（共享库等）
  • 支持动态加载和动态链接

非连续分配的缺点

  • 如何建立虚拟地址和物理地址之间的转换
    • 软件方案
    • 硬件方案

两种硬件方案

  • 分段
  • 分页

分段寻址方案

堆、栈、数据、程序分散放

一个段：一个内存“块”

x86采用的是段寄存器+地址寄存器实现方案

分页寻址方案

与分段的主要区别：段尺寸可变，页/页帧大小固定不变

  • 划分物理内存至固定大小的帧（页帧 - frame - 物理页）

  • 划分逻辑地址空间至相同大小的页（page - 逻辑页）

    帧和页的大小是2的幂，比如512，4096，8192

  • 建立方案 转换逻辑地址为物理地址（pages to frames）

    • 页表
    • MMU（内存管理单元）/TLB（快表）

帧（Frame）

f：帧号

o：帧内偏移

S：表示帧内偏移的地址长度（2S正好是帧大小）

F：帧号长度

物理地址 = $ 2^S × f + o $

$ 2^S $：每个页的大小

$ 2^S × f $：第几号页

页（page）

计算方法同上

在操作系统的内存管理范例

实现高度依赖于硬件

  • 必须知道内存架构
  • MMU（内存管理单元）：硬件组件负责处理CPU的内存访问请求

地址空间&地址生成

地址空间定义

逻辑地址最终还是对应物理地址

地址生成

程序的逻辑地址加偏移量生成在内存中可以运行的逻辑地址（通过MMU映射表转换成物理地址）

偏移量不需要操作系统（通过应用程序、编译器、loader）

逻辑地址和物理地址的映射关系由操作系统建立

寻址过程：

CPU拿着逻辑地址->MMU->物理地址

CPU拿着逻辑地址->MMU找不到映射->直接按照逻辑地址在内存中找

地址安全检查

也是有区域限制的表

连续内存分配

内存碎片问题

外部碎片

内部碎片

分区的动态分配

第一适配（首次适配First Fit）

从头空闲块挨个地找，直到找到大小合适的可用空闲块

  • 需求
    • 按地址排序的空闲块列表
    • 分配需要寻找一个合适的分区
    • 重分配需要检查，看是否自由分区能合并于相邻的空闲分区（若有）

优势

  • 简单
  • 易于产生更大空闲块，向着地址空间的结尾

劣势

  • 外部碎片
  • 不确定性
最佳适配（Best Fit）

  • 为了避免分割大空闲块
  • 为了最小化外部碎片产生的尺寸
  • 需求
    • 按尺寸排列的空闲块列表
    • 分配需要寻找一个合适的分区
    • 重分配需要搜索及合并于相邻的空闲分区（若有）

优势

  • 当大部分分配是小尺寸时非常有效
  • 比较简单

劣势

  • 外部碎片
  • 重分配慢
  • 易产生很多没用的微小碎片
最差适配（Worst Fit）

看似离谱，但有利于减少微小碎片

  • 为了避免有太多微小的碎片
  • 需求
    • 按尺寸排列的空闲块列表
    • 分配很快（获得最大的分区）
    • 重分配需要合并于相邻的空闲分区（若有），然后调整空闲块列表

优势

  • 假如分配是中等尺寸效果最好

劣势

  • 重分配慢
  • 外部碎片
  • 易于破碎大的空闲块以致大分区无法被分配

压缩式碎片整理

交换式碎片整理

entry.title: OS_1 - 启动
entry.content:
启动

启动

计算机体系结构概述

DISK：存放OS

BIOS：基本I/O处理系统（检查外设等）

Bootloader：加载OS，一般放在硬盘的第一个主引导扇区

计算机内存和硬盘布局

开机顺序

BIOS加载Bootloader，Bootloader加载操作系统

中断、异常和系统调用

interrupt、exception、system call

背景

中断、异常和系统调用相比较

  • 中断（来源于外设）

    • 来自不同的硬件设备的计时器和网络的中断

  • 异常（来源于不良的应用程序）

    • 非法指令或者其他坏的处理状态（如：内存出错）

  • 系统调用（来源于应用程序）

    • 应用程序主动向操作系统发出服务请求（读写文件、发送网络包等）

处理时间

  • 中断：异步
  • 异常：同步
  • 系统调用：异步或同步

相应

  • 中断：持续，对用户应用程序是透明的
  • 异常：杀死或者重新执行意想不到的应用程序指令
  • 系统调用：等待和持续

中断和异常处理机制

中断

硬件

  • 设置中断标记[CPU初始化]（CPU看到中断标记后把中断号发给操作系统进行相应处理）
    1. 将内部、外部事件设置中断标记
    2. 中断时间的ID

软件

  • 保存当前处理状态
  • 中断服务程序处理（比如网络中断，处理数据包）
  • 清除中断标记
  • 恢复之前保存的处理状态
异常

产生异常编号

  • 保存现场
  • 异常处理
    • 杀死产生了异常的程序
    • 或重新执行异常指令（OS进行弥补修复工作，再恢复现场并重新执行指令，这个过程对应用程序也是透明的）
  • 恢复现场

系统调用

程序访问主要是通过高层次的API接口而不是直接进行系统调用

用户态：CPU特权低，不能直接访问一些特殊的指令，不能直接访问I/O

内核态：完全控制整个计算机系统

当应用程序调用系统调用时，会完成从用户态到内核态的转换，从而使得控制权从用户程序到操作系统手上，操作系统根据系统调用ID号完成具体的服务

程序调用与系统调用的不同之处

应用程序发出函数调用：一个栈空间完成参数传递和参数返回

系统调用：应用程序和内核有各自的堆栈，除了特权级的转换，还需要切换堆栈

开销

特权级的转换和切换堆栈都会带来开销，系统调用的开销比应用程序函数调用的开销大很多，但是也确保了操作系统安全可靠地运行

entry.title: ori指令说明
entry.content:
ori指令说明

ori是进行逻辑“或”运算的指令
指令码 6’b001101

指令格式

31 ~ 2625 ~ 2120 ~ 1615 ~ 0
ORI 001101rsrtimmediate

指令用法

ori rs, rt, immediate

指令作用

将指令中的16位立即数immediate进行无符号拓展至32位，然后与索引位rs的通用寄存器的值进行逻辑“或”运算，运算结果保存到索引为rt的通用寄存器中

entry.title: Web知识杂烩
entry.content:
学习自：https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1uA411u7kD

端口

  • 虚拟端口：程序和网络进行通信的端口，不是随意使用的，而是按照一定的规定分配

    端口就好比是一个房子的某个房间的门

  • 端口号：只有整数，从0到65535

    short型，两个字节共16位，所以范围是0~216-1

  • 知名端口

    0~1023

    • 80：HTTP

    • 21：FTP

  • 动态端口

    不固定分配某种服务，而是动态分配

    1024~65535

TCP服务器

流程

  1. socket创建一个套接字

  2. bind绑定ip和port

  3. listen使套接字变为可以被动链接

  4. accept等待客户端的链接

  5. recv/send接受发送数据

entry.title: TIME_1
entry.content:
【TIME】Biden Acts to Undo Trump Policies

2021/01/22

Joe Biden was sworn in as the 46 President of the United States on a cold, bright Wednesday afternoon in the nation’s capital. In his first speech, Biden pledged to defend the nation and fight the multiple crises facing Americans. “Together, we shall write an American story of hope not fear, of unity not division, of light, not darkness,” he said.

乔·拜登在一个寒冷晴朗的星期三下午，于国家首都宣誓就职合众国第46届总统。拜登在他的演讲中发誓要守护国家，与美国人面临的问题作斗争。他说：“团结一致，我们将书写充满希望、统一、光明而非充满恐惧、分裂、黑暗的美国故事”。

Inauguration Day is always a momentous occasion in the United States, but this year the tension in the country and the challenges facing the new administration put an unprecedented spotlight on the day. The transition of power was not peaceful: Donald Trump incited a riot of his supporters on Jan. 6 that disrupted the counting of Electoral College votes in the Capitol and left five people dead. The heart of the nation’s capital has taken on the appearance of a conflict zone, with thousands of National Guard troops stationed around the city and a series of barricades and fences encircling the Capitol Building where Biden will be sworn in.

就职典礼日通常是重要的一天，但是今年不一样，全国的紧张状态和新政府所面临的挑战使得这一天成为空前引人注目的日子。权力过渡并不和平：特朗普煽动他的支持者在1月6日暴乱，干扰了在国会进行的选举人团计票流程并导致5人丧生。首都中心呈现出冲突地带的模样，成千上万的国民警卫队驻守在城市周围，连串的障碍和围栏将国会大厦包围起来，拜登将在那里宣誓就职。

A Senate impeachment trial over Trump’s incitement of the riot will now loom over the early days of Biden’s presidency. Trump left town early before Biden’s swearing in, breaking with more than 100 years of precedent of outgoing presidents attending the event. Meanwhile, the coronavirus pandemic continues to rage throughout the country. More than 400,000 Americans have died since the beginning of the pandemic, and Biden now needs to manage the complicated rollout of life-saving vaccines.

一场针对特朗普煽动暴乱一事的参议院弹劾审判将会在拜登总统任期的前几天进行。特朗普在拜登宣誓就职之前很早就离开了华盛顿，这也打破了超过100年以来卸任总统参加典礼的先例。同时，新冠疫情继续肆虐着这个国家。疫情爆发以来，美国死亡人数已经超过40万，拜登现在需要好好管理用来救命的新冠疫苗的推出。

A little before 4 pm, President Biden and First Lady Jill Biden walked with their family onto the White House grounds. A buoyant Biden greeted a few people along the way. After a final wave to the parade route and a short break for photos, the Bidens hugged each other and walked into their new home.

下午4点多，拜登总统和第一夫人——吉尔·拜登与家人们一起走进白宫。拜登看起来很有活力，路上与一些人打了招呼。向游行群众挥手示意并拍照后，拜登一家人互相拥抱并走进了他们的新家园。

Vice President Kamala Harris and Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff spent some of the final moments of Inauguration Day standing near the “I Have a Dream” inscription on the Lincoln Memorial steps, watching as fireworks went off over Washington. Harris and Emhoff stood surrounded by a group that included family as Katy Perry performed “Firework.”

典礼的最后，副总统哈里斯和她老公埃姆霍夫站在“我有一个梦想”标语的纪念碑旁边的林肯纪念堂阶梯上停留了一会，观赏越过华盛顿上空的烟花。

They also danced to “Lovely Day” while holding hands, shortly after Harris gave her first formal speech as Vice President out of presiding over the Senate.

就在哈里斯作为副总统在参议院主持的第一个正式演讲结束后，他们还手牵着手，随着《美好的一天》起舞。

In her speech, Harris urged Americans to remain strong in the face of adversity: “We are undaunted in our belief that we shall overcome, that we will rise up,” she said.

在她的演讲中，哈里斯敦促美国人坚持勇敢面对逆境，她说：”我们对于我们终将克服困境，逆势而起的信念坚定不移。“

Tom Hanks was the host of the virtual Inauguration Day celebration, which was broadcast nationwide. In addition to Perry, the show featured performances by John Legend, Bruce Springsteen, Justin Timberlake and Ant Clemons.

汤姆·汉克斯主持了网上的就职日庆典并在全国广播。除了佩里，该节目还邀请了约翰·传奇、布鲁斯·斯普林斯汀、贾斯汀·汀布莱克和安特·克莱蒙斯表演。

Lin-Manuel Miranda, chef José Andrés, Kerry Washington and Eva Longoria were also among the big names who made appearances.

entry.title: 预备知识
entry.content:
函数的四种特性

有界性、单调性、奇偶性、周期性

有界性

设f(x)的定义域为D，数集I⊂D。如果存在某个正数M，使对任一x∈I，有**|f(x)|≤M（加上绝对值正好上下界都有了），则称f(x)在I上有界；如果这样的M不存在，则称f(x)在I上无界**。

求解

  1. 找一个正数

  2. 极限

单调性

求解

  1. 定义法

    根据
    $$
    (x_1 - x_2)[f(x_1) - f(x_2)]
    $$
    判断

  2. 导数

    求导

奇偶性 ☆

周期性

$$
f(x+T)=f(x)
$$

错误信息

解决方法

运行命令

testtable是我的表名，改成自己的再重新导入即可。

entry.title: words_39
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/04/01

total 23 words 1 similar

atlas

  • n. 地图集
  • a book of maps
  • exp. The atlas contains information about all the countries in the world.

bureaucracy

  • n. 官僚主义；政府机构
  • the system of official rules and ways of doing things that a government or an organization has, especially when these seem to be too complicated
  • exp. The bureaucracy always makes people go through unnecessary procedures.

inaugurate

  • v. 为···揭幕；为···举行就职典礼；开展
  • to officially open a building or start an organization with a special ceremony
  • exp. By cutting this ribbon, we inaugurate the opening of the new store!

vent

  • n. 通风口，排气口；
  • exp. The vent takes old air out and pushes fresh air in.
  • v. 发泄 (情绪)，开孔，泄露

dispute

  • n. 争论，争端；
  • an argument or a disagreement between two people, groups or countries; discussion about a subject where there is disagreement
  • exp. They had a dispute over who should be his dance partner.
  • v. 争执，驳斥

resume

  • n. 简历；
  • a written record of your education and the jobs you have done, that you send when you are applying for a job
  • exp. The HR team are examining the resumes of the interviewees.
  • v. 重新开始；继续；
  • vt. 回到；恢复；重新开始

solitary

  • a. 孤独的，单独的，隐居的
  • done alone; without other people; (of a person or an animal) enjoying being alone; frequently spending time alone;
  • exp. A solitary man is standing in the cold wind alone.

qualitative

  • a. (性) 质的，定性的
  • connected with what something is like or how good it is, rather than with how much of it there is
  • exp. Changes in temperature can lead to qualitative differences.

prosecute

  • v. 起诉；做检察官；从事
  • to officially charge somebody with a crime in court
  • exp. He was prosecuted because of owing his friends’ money.

staple

  • v. 用订书钉订；
  • to attach one thing to another using a staple or staples
  • exp. Please staples the two sheets of paper together.
  • n. 订书钉；主食；主要产品；
  • a. 主要的；基本的；标准的

beam

  • n. 光线；(房屋等) 大梁；(横) 梁；
  • a line of light, electric waves or particles
  • exp. A sun beam reaches down through the clouds.
  • v. 发光；照射；发射，播送

commute

  • v. 经常乘车往返于两地之间；
  • to travel regularly by bus, train, car, etc. between your place of work and your home
  • exp. I commute from my home to the office by bus every day.
  • n. 在两地之间乘车往返；
  • vt. 减免

versatile

  • a. 万能的，综合的，多才多艺的
  • (of a person) able to do many different thing; (of food, a building, etc.) having many different uses
  • exp. He’s a versatile musician who can play a wide variety of musical instruments.

verbal

  • a. 言语的，口头的，动词的
  • relating to words; spoken, not written; relating to verbs
  • exp. Thanks to her great verbal skills she delivered a brilliant presentation.

embody

  • v. 体现，象征
  • to express or represent an idea or a quality
  • exp. The lotus flower embodies purity and integrity.

batch

  • n. 一批 (人或物)；一批生产量
  • a number of people or things that are dealt with as a group
  • exp. I just finished this batch of cookies - would you like one?

premise

  • n. 前提；房屋地基；
  • a statement or an idea that forms the basis for a reasonable line of argument
  • exp. This is the movie’s premise; Two people are trapped on an island and they end up falling in love!
  • v. 假定

deviate

  • v. 偏离；背离
  • to be different from something; to do something in a different way from what is usual or expected
  • exp. The hiker has deviated from the main route; let’s hope he can reach his destination.

glacier

  • n. 冰川，冰河
  • a large mass of ice, formed by snow on mountains,
  • exp. The glacier is made up of big blocks of ice.

oversee

  • v. 监督；偷看到，无意中看到
  • to watch somebody / something and make sure that a job or an activity is done correctly
  • exp. The company brought in a new manager to oversee operations.
  • similar. overhear
    • v. 无意中听到，偷听到

prescribe

  • v. 给···开药；命令，指示
  • (of a doctor) to tell somebody to take a particular medicine or have a particular treatment; to write a prescription for a particular medicine, etc.
  • exp. The doctor prescribed me some medicine for my cold.

psychiatry

  • n. 精神病治疗法
  • the study and treatment of mental illness
  • exp. Psychiatry can be very helpful for patients suffering from mental illness.

hitchhike

  • v. 免费搭乘他人便车
  • to get a ride in a passing vehicle by holding out your arm with your thumb up as you stand on the side of the road
  • exp. The girl sitting on the roadside is trying to hitchhike.

brink

  • exp. The tennis player quenches her thirst with water.

throughout

degrade

apparatus

  • n. 装置，仪器；设备
  • a tool or piece of equipment used for specific activities
  • exp. The apparatus here can be used to make a great cup of coffee.

encyclopedia

  • n. 百科全书
  • a book or set of books giving information about all areas of knowledge or about different areas of one particular subject, usually arranged in alphabetical order; a similar collection of information on a website or CD-ROM
  • exp. This plant encyclopedia has many beautiful illustrations.

confer

  • v. 授予 (奖项、学位、荣誉或权利) ；商讨，协商
  • to give somebody an award, a university degree or a particular honor or right
  • exp. The president conferred a degree onto the graduating student.

banquet

  • n. (正式的) 宴会；盛宴
  • a formal meal for a large number of people, usually for a special occasion, at which speeches are often made
  • exp. The banquet had many different kinds of food.

lure

  • v. 以诱饵吸引；
  • to persuade or trick somebody to go somewhere or to do something by promising them a reward
  • exp. I lure fish by putting worms on my fishing pole.
  • n. 诱惑物

rig

  • n. 钻井架；装备；帆具；成套器械；
  • (especially in compounds) a large piece of equipment that is used for taking oil or gas from the ground or the bottom of the sea
  • exp. The oil rig extracts oil from the ocean.
  • v. 操纵；装配；欺骗

momentum

  • n. (物理) 动量；势头；动力
  • a force that is gained by movement
  • exp. His momentum caused him to go up into the air.

indispensable

  • a. 必不可少的；必需的
  • too important to be without
  • exp. WiFi is indispensable in modern life.

sanction

  • n. 批准；
  • an official order that limits trade, contact, etc. with a particular country, in order to make it do something, such as obeying international law
  • exp. The installation of air conditioners received sanction from the boss.
  • v. 批准，支持，对···实施制裁

moist

  • a. (表面) 潮湿的，湿润的
  • slightly wet
  • exp. The grass is moist due to last night’s heavy rain.

entry.title: words_34
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/03/26

total 15 words 1 similar

coil

  • n. (一) 卷，(一) 圈；
  • a series of circles formed by winding up a length of rope, wire, etc.
  • exp. This is a coil of metal wire.

riot

  • v. 闹事；
  • (of a crowd of people) to behave in a violent way in a public place, often as a protest
  • exp. The angry villagers are rioting in the street.
  • n. 骚乱；暴乱；骚动；放纵

observance

  • n. 庆祝，礼仪，仪式；(法律习俗等的) 遵守
  • the practice of obeying a law, celebrating a festival or behaving according to particular custom
  • exp. In observance of Christmas, we put up a tree and give each other girls.

oblige

  • v. 迫使，使感激，施恩于，帮忙，使···成为必要
  • to force somebody to do something, by law, because it is a duty, etc.; to help somebody by doing what they ask or what you know they want
  • exp. Tax payers are obliged to pay tax accordingly.

mortgage

  • n. 按揭贷款，抵押贷款；
  • a legal agreement by which a bank or similar organization lends you money to buy a house, etc., and you pay the money back over a particular number of years; the sum of money that you borrow
  • exp. He took out a mortgage, meaning he borrowed money to buy his home.
  • v. 抵押

clear up

  • v. 放晴，清楚，整理

monologue

  • n. 独白，个人长篇演说
  • a long speech by one person during a conversation that stops other people from speaking or expressing an opinion; a long speech in a play, film / movie, etc. spoken by one actor, especially when alone; a dramatic story, especially in verse, told or performed by one person
  • exp. The entire play was just a two hour monologue by one person; it was so boring!

impromptu

  • a. 即席的，即兴的；
  • done without preparation or planning
  • exp. At the command of his brother, he composed an impromptu poem within seven paces.
  • adv. 即席地，即兴地；
  • n. 即兴之作

surmount

  • v. 克服，战胜，超过
  • to deal successfully with a difficulty; to be placed on top of something
  • exp. The man surmounts the house and rides it forward.

aesthetic

  • a. 美学的；审美的；悦目的；雅致的
  • concerned with beauty and art and the understanding of beautiful things
  • exp. The oil painting has great aesthetic value.

bowel

  • n. 肠；内部
  • the tube along which food passes after it has been through the stomach, especially the end where waste is collected before it is passed out of the body
  • exp. The doctor tells me that my bowel is very healthy.

tuck

  • v. 把 (衬衫、餐巾等的) 边塞到里面；
  • to push, fold or turn the ends or edges of clothes, paper, etc. so that they are held in place or look neat
  • exp. I tucked my blouse into my skirt to look presentable.
  • n. (衣服等的) 褶，裥

bring in

  • v. 增加，赚取，产生，引进
  • to attract somebody / something to a place or business; to make or earn a particular amount of money
  • exp. The city brought in lots of talented people.

groan

  • v. 呻吟；抱怨；
  • to make a long deep sound because you are annoyed, upset or in pain, or with pleasure
  • exp. The woman loudly groaned due to her splitting headache.
  • n. 呻吟

overhear

  • v. 无意中听到，偷听到
  • to hear, especially by accident, a conversation in which you are not involved
  • exp. This father overheard his children talking.
  • similar. oversee
    • v. 监督；偷看到，无意中看到

entry.title: words_33
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/03/25

total 13 words 1 similar

preliminary

  • a. 初步的，预备的；
  • happening before a more important action or event
  • exp. The preliminary drawings of the building are already finished.
  • n. 预赛；预考，初始；初步措施

composite

  • a. 合成的，复合的；
  • made of different parts or materials
  • exp. She made a composite photo of herself at the beach.
  • n. 合成物，复合材料

arrogant

  • a. 傲慢的，妄自尊大的
  • behaving in a proud, unpleasant way, showing little thought for other people
  • exp. The arrogant man refused to listen to anyone else’s ideas.

stimulus

  • n. 鼓励；促进因素
  • something that helps somebody / something to develop better or more quickly
  • exp. A big red flower means a stimulus to her.

surge

  • v. 波浪般汹涌奔腾；激增；
  • to move very quickly and suddenly in a particular direction
  • exp. The water surges over the road.
  • n. 波涛汹涌
  • similar. surgeon
    • n. 外科医生

discrete

  • a. 分开的；不连续的
  • independent of other things of the same type
  • exp. The abacus is made up of discrete units.
    算盘是由分开的单元组成的。

elastic

  • a. 可伸缩的，(系统或计划) 灵活的；
  • that can change or be changed
  • exp. The spring is very elastic thing that can stretch far.
  • n. 松紧带，橡皮圈

obscene

  • a. 下流的，淫秽的
  • exp. The male monkey makes obscene display of his red buttock to attract the female.

illiterate

  • n. 文盲，目不识丁者；
  • (of a person) not knowing how to read or write
  • exp. Illiterates cannot read.
  • a. 缺乏 (某方面) 知识的

set off

  • phr. 出发
  • to begin a journey
  • exp. The pirates set of from the island.

loom

  • n. 织布机；
  • a machine for making cloth by twisting threads betwween other threads which go in a different direction
  • exp. The girl is operating the loom to weave the cloth.
  • v. 阴森地逼近；隐现；即将来临

stitch

  • v. 缝，绣；
  • to use a needle and thread to repair, join, or decorate pieces of cloth; to sew the edges of a wound together
  • exp. The cobbler is stitching a part of the shoe using the sewing machine.
    鞋匠用缝纫机来缝合鞋的部件。

restrain

  • v. 抑制 (愤怒等)，控制
  • to stop somebody / something from doing something, especially by using physical force; to stop yourself from feeling an emotion or doing something that you would like to do
  • exp. I must restrain my anger because he is the boss.

entry.title: words_32
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/03/24

total 28 words

feasible

  • a. 可行的，行得通的
  • that is possible and likely to be achieved
  • exp. I think your construction plan is feasible. Let’s start to build the house!

convert

  • v. 可转变为，可变换成；改变，转变，转化；使改变信仰
  • to be able to be changed from one form, purpose or system to another
  • exp. Cool! The sofa can be easily converted into a bed.

martyr

  • n. 烈士；
  • a person who suffers very much or is killed because of their religious or political beliefs
  • exp. He died in the line of duty and was dubbed a martyr.
  • v. 迫害，折磨

tentative

  • a. 试探性的；不确定的；暂时的；犹豫不决的
  • not behaving or done with confidence
  • exp. When walking in darkness, every step you take is tentative.

condolence

  • n. 哀悼；吊唁
  • sympathy that you feel for somebody when a person in their family or that they know well has died; an expression of this sympathy
  • exp. People lit candles to show their condolence for the earthquake victims.

wholesale

  • n. 批发；
  • in large quantities, especially so they can be sold again to make a profit
  • exp. Retailers buy things in wholesale.
  • a. 大规模的；批发的

whilst

  • conj. 当···的时候；
  • at the same time as something else is happening; during the time that something is happening
  • exp. They were at their happiest whilst playing soccer.
  • n. 一会儿；一段时间

scandal

  • n. 丑闻；丢脸；流言蜚语；反感；愤慨
  • behavior or an event that people think is morally or legally wrong and causes public feelings of shock or anger
  • exp. Mr. Giraffe was involved in the academic scandal and received widespread media coverage.

sphere

  • n. 球；领域
  • any object that is completely round, for example a ball
  • exp. The world is not flat; it it a sphere.

commodity

  • n. 商品，货物
  • a product or a raw material that can be bought and sold; a thing that is useful or has a useful quality
  • exp. You can find many commodities in supermarkets.

attain

  • v. 获得；达到 (某个年纪、水平、条件) ；实现；
  • to succeed in getting something, usually after a lot of effort
  • exp. I finally attained my driving license!
  • n. 成就

definitive

  • a. 可靠的，明确的，权威的
  • considered to be the best of its kind and almost impossible to improve
  • exp. The new law is definitive; we now know exactly what it means.

incidence

  • n. 发生率，入射角度
  • the extent to which something happens or has an effect
  • exp. The incidence of heart disease goes up as people get older.

verdict

  • n. (陪审团) 裁决
  • a decision that is made by a jury in court, stating if somebody is considered guilty of a crime or not
  • exp. The judge is making his final verdict.

notion

  • n. 观点，看法；概念，观念；突然的念头；意图
  • an idea, a belief or an understanding of something
  • exp. Many Chinese have the notion that all French men are romantic.

voucher

  • n. 代金券；教育补助金券；
  • a printed piece of paper that can be used instead of money to pay for something, or that allows you to pay less than the usual price of something
  • exp. I won a voucher worth $5000, but only for purchasing the private jet.
  • vt. 证实···的可靠性

piston

  • n. 活塞，瓣
  • a part of an engine that consists of a short cylinder that fits inside a tube and moves up and down or backwards and forwards to make other parts of the engine move
  • exp. He is standing in a garage with a piston in his hands.

sophisticated

  • a. (仪器) 精密的，复杂的；老于世故的，老练的，富有经验的；高雅的，精致的
  • Someone is comfortable in social situations and knows about culture, fashion, and other matters that are considered socially important.
  • exp. This machine is quite sophisticated.

provoke

  • v. 激怒；对···挑衅
  • to say or do something that you know will annoy somebody so that they react in an angry way
  • exp. The basketball player’s dirty behavior really provoked his opponent.

commence

  • v. 开始
  • to begin to happen; to begin something
  • exp. We were about to commence the race.

intimate

  • a. 亲密的，密切的；详细的；
  • (of knowledge) very detailed and thorough
  • exp. Nothing is sweeter than intimate lovers.
  • v. 宣布，通知；
  • n. 密友，知己

reproach

  • v. 责备，指责；
  • to blame or criticize somebody for something that they have done or not done, because you are disappointed in them; to feel guilty about something that you think you should have done in a different way
  • exp. The master reproached the dog for destroying the sofa.
  • n. 指责

reconcile

  • v. 和解；调解；调和
  • one find an acceptable way of dealing with two or more ideas, needs, etc. that seem to be opposed to each other; to make people become friends again after an argument or a disagreement
  • exp. They are desperate to reconcile and fix their broken hearts.

implement

  • n. 工具；器具；
  • a tool or an instrument, often one that is quite simple and that is used outdoors
  • exp. I use these implements to take care of my garden.
  • v. 实施，执行

impart

  • v. 传授，给予，将 (某性质) 给予或赋予某事物
  • to pass information, knowledge, etc. to other people; to give a particular quality to something
  • exp. A teacher’s duty is to impart knowledge to students.

buffet

  • n. 自助餐，(火车内) 餐室，冷餐桌；
  • a meal at which people serve themselves from a table and then stand or sit somewhere else to eat
  • exp. You can eat as much as you like at the buffet.
  • v. 反复敲打，打击，重击

outset

  • n. 开始，开端
  • the start or beginning of something
  • exp. You need to be well prepared from the outset.

engrave

  • v. 雕刻
  • to cut words or designs on wood, stone, metal, etc.
  • exp. The artist is engraving patterns into the wood.

entry.title: words_31
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/03/23

total 25 words

hinder

  • v. 阻碍，妨碍
  • to make it difficult for somebody to do something or for something to happen
  • exp. The obstacle really hinders my forward progress.

impetus

  • n. 推动力；促进
  • the force or energy with which something moves
  • exp. His boss’s praise gives him the impetus to work harder.

prone

  • a. 易于···的；有···倾向的；俯卧的
  • likely to suffer from something or to do something bad
  • exp. Dogs are prone to pee indoors.

monotonous

  • a. 单调的，无聊的
  • never changing and therefore boring
  • exp. My breakfast routine is so monotonous; I eat steamed bread every day.

locomotive

  • n. 机车，火车头
  • a railway engine that pulls a train
  • exp. Old locomotives ran on coal and steam.

breach

  • n. 裂痕；破裂；冲击；违反；
  • a break in a relationship between people or countries
  • exp. The situation became very dangerous because of the breach in the dam.
  • v. 使有裂口；破坏

ensue

  • v. 跟着发生，接踵而来
  • to happen after or as a result of another event
  • exp. Landslide ensued after the storm.

perish

  • vi. 死去；
  • (of people or animals) to die, especially in a sudden violent way
  • exp. A family of three ducks perished in the fire.
  • v. 脆裂，老化，腐烂

lateral

  • a. 侧面的；横向的；
  • connected with the side of something or with movement to the side
  • exp. I love your profile - I want a picture with a lateral view of you.
  • n. 侧面部分

blunder

  • n. 愚蠢之举；大错；
  • a stupid or careless mistake
  • exp. He forgot to bring his parachute! What a terrible blunder that is!
  • vi. 犯大错；
  • v. 失策；绊倒

lump

  • n. 肿块；粗笨的人；
  • a swelling under the skin, sometimes a sign of serious illness
  • exp. There is a lump on his neck.
  • v. 成团，成堆；使成块；
  • n. 一小方块 (糖)

diminish

  • v. 减少；失势，削弱···的权势，减弱···的权势
  • to become or to make something become smaller, weaker, etc.
  • exp. This is terrible! Our profits are still diminishing, why?

glamour

  • n. 魅力；诱惑力
  • physical beauty that also suggests wealth or success
  • exp. Her glamour impresses me every time I see her.

shaft

  • n. 柄；轴；杆状物；
  • the long narrow part of an arrow, hammer, golf club, etc.
  • exp. A croquet mallet has a thin shaft and a heavy head.
  • vt. 给···装杆；
  • v. 苟刻地对待

sightseeing

  • n. 游览；观光
  • the activity of visiting the famous or interesting places of an area
  • exp. I like to go sightseeing around seaside towns.

pendulum

  • n. 摆，钟摆；摇摆不定的事态 (或局面)
  • a long straight part with a weight at the end that moves regularly from side to side to control the movement of a clock
  • exp. The pendulum of the clock swung back and forth.

augment

  • v. 增加；助长
  • to increase the amount, value, size, etc. of something
  • exp. He augmented his income through freelance writing/

crumble

  • v. 弄碎；使破碎；崩溃；破灭；
  • to break or break something into very small pieces
  • exp. He crumbled the snack noodle into pieces before eating it.
  • n. 碎屑；面包屑

scrap

  • n. 废金属；小块，小片；碎片；口角，吵架；
  • a small piece of something, especially paper, cloth, etc.
  • exp. All these old cars will be used as scrap.
  • v. 报废；舍弃；打架

slum

  • n. 贫民窟，贫民区，陋巷
  • an area of a city that is very poor and where the houses are dirty and in bad condition
  • exp. The living conditions in this slum are shockingly poor.

instantaneous

  • a. 瞬间的；即刻的；猝发的
  • happening immediately
  • exp. When stabbing the balloon, there was an instantaneous burst.

imperative

  • a. 必要的；祈使的；急需的；
  • very important and needing immediate attention or action
  • exp. It is imperative to call 119 if your house is on fire.
  • n. 命令；必要的事；义务；驱使

plunge

  • v. 跳进，(使) 投入；使陷入；暴跌；
  • to move or make somebody / something move suddenly forwards and / or downwards; to move up and down suddenly and violently
  • exp. The sportswoman plunged into the water, splash!

manure

  • n. 肥料；
  • the waste matter from animals that is spread over or mixed with the soil to help plants and crops grow
  • exp. The farmer adds manure to the crops to help them grow.
  • v. 施肥于

ingenious

  • a. 聪明的；有发明天才的；有独创性的，别出心裁的
  • (of a person) having a lot of clever new ideas and good at inventing things
  • exp. He’s an ingenious boy who always has wonderful ideas.

entry.title: words_30
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/03/22

total 20 words

retain

  • v. 保持，保留，保存
  • to keep something; to continue to have something; to continue to hold or contain something;
  • exp. Hot water can retain its heat for hours in the vacuum cup.

decimal

  • n. 小数；
  • a fraction (= a number less than one) that is shown as a dot or point followed by the number of tenths, hundredths, etc.
  • exp. The decimal 0.5 is less than 1.
  • a. 小数的；十进制的

scorn

  • n. 鄙视；
  • a strong feeling that somebody / something is stupid or not good enough, usually shown by the way you speak
  • exp. She scorned her work colleague who just read magazines all day.
  • v. 轻蔑；对···不屑一顾

overwhelm

  • v. 压垮；打败，压倒
  • to have such a strong emotional effect on somebody that it is difficult for them to resist or know how to react
  • exp. She is being totally overwhelmed by her work load.

speculate

  • vt. 推测；
  • to form an opinion about something without knowing all thee details or facts
  • exp. I speculate the trend of foreign exchange market to make money.
  • vi. 投机，做投机买卖；推测，猜测

defiance

  • n. 蔑视；抗议，反抗；挑战
  • the act of defying someone or something; a refusal to obey something or someone
  • exp. There’s a look of defiance on his face.

grant

  • v. 给予，许可，授予；
  • to agree to give somebody what they ask for, especially formal or legal permission to do something
  • exp. The Subway Committee grants the blind permission to bring guide dogs on board.
  • n. 许可

expel

  • v. 罚出，开除；排出；开除；驱逐
  • to officially make somebody leave a school or an organization
  • exp. The referee expels a player from the game for not playing by the rules.

orthodox

  • a. 正统的
  • (especially of beliefs or behavior) generally accepted or approved of; following generally accepted beliefs
  • exp. The Greek orthodox church with blue domes is so beautiful.

spill

  • v. 使流出；浇 (花等) ；
  • to cause or allow (something) to fall, flow, or run over the edge of a container usually in an accidental way
  • exp. Oh no, I’ve spilled the green nail polish.
  • n. 溢出，溅出

superficial

  • a. 表面的；肤浅的；微不足道的；
  • not studying or looking at something thoroughly; seeing only what is obvious
  • exp. The house may look new, but it’s all superficial.
  • n. 表面文章

eminent

  • a. 杰出的
  • (of people) famous and respected, especially in a particular profession
  • exp. He is the eminent Chinese writer who won the Nobel Prize.

graze

  • v. (牲畜) 吃草；
  • (of cows, sheep, etc.) to eat grass that is growing in a field
  • exp. Cows are grazing on the grass in the meadow.
  • n. 擦，擦伤

odd

  • a. 奇怪的；古怪的；奇数的
  • strange or unusual
  • exp. It is so odd of him to be like this.

stipulate

  • v. 规定；保证；要求以···为条件
  • to state clearly and firmly that something must be done, or how it must be done
  • exp. The confidentially agreements stipulate that moviegoers can not reveal any plot of the movie.
    保密协议规定，所有观影人不得透露影片的任何情节。

seam

  • n. 接缝；缝；地层
  • a line along which two edges of cloth, etc. are joined or sewn together
  • exp. There are seams on this white cloth.

avert

  • v. 转移 (目光，注意力等) ；防止；避开
  • to turn your eyes, etc. away from something that you do not want to see
  • exp. They all averted their eyes from each other.

thermal

  • a. 保暖的；温泉的；
  • (of clothing) designed to keep you warm by preventing heat from escaping from the body
  • exp. Gloves, scarfs and thermal underwear help keep you warm in winter.
  • n. 保暖内衣裤

succession

  • n. 一连串；连续，继续
  • a number of people or things that follow each other in time or order
  • exp. A succession of horses passed us in the forest.

exquisite

  • a. 精致的，精选的
  • extremely beautiful or carefully made
  • exp. I’ve spent all my cash to buy you this exquisite necklace.

entry.title: words_29
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/03/21

total 19 words

session

  • n. (法庭的) 开庭；(议会等的) 开会
  • a formal meeting or series of meetings of a court, a parliament, etc.; a period of time when such meetings are held; a period of time that is spent doing a particular activity
  • exp. The court is in session, and the lawyer is presenting the evidence.

maneuver

  • v. 操纵；
  • a movement performed with care and skill; a clever plan, action or movement that is used to give somebody an advantage
  • exp. The skilled pilot can maneuver the helicopter very well.
  • n. 花招

hazardous

  • a. 有危险的；碰运气的
  • involving risk or danger, especially to somebody’s health or safety
  • exp. It is hazardous to touch the tiger’s butt.

hurl

  • v. 用力投掷
  • to throw something / somebody violently in a particular direction
  • exp. When she graduated, she hurled her books into the air.

portfolio

  • n. 公文包，文件夹，投资组合
  • a thin flat case used for carrying documents, drawings, etc.; (finance) a set of shares owned by a particular person or organization
  • exp. He checked his portfolio to find some documents.

practicable

  • a. 能实行的，行得通的
  • able to be done; likely to be successful
  • exp. The boy put forward a practicable solution to get the weight of the elephant.

intent

  • a. 全神贯注的；专心致志的；
  • exp. He looked at the computer screen with an intent expression.
  • n. 意图；意向；目的

gloomy

  • a. 愁容满面的，阴暗的，没有希望的
  • nearly dark, or badly lit in a way that makes you feel sad; sad and without hope; without much hope of success or happiness in the future
  • exp. The little boy is in a really gloomy mood.

appreciable

  • a. 可察觉的；很可观的；可感知的；可评估的
  • large enough to be noticed or thought important
  • exp. The girl went through an appreciable change in looks.

excess

  • a. 额外的，过量的，过度的，附加的；
  • in addition to an amount that is necessary, usual or legal
  • exp. A man threw an excess of chickpea into the bin after dinner.
  • n. 超越，超过，过度

nevertheless

  • adv. 然而，不过；尽管如此，不过，仍然
  • despite something that you have just mentioned
  • exp. The dog laughed at the rabbit. Nevertheless, the rabbit still helped him out.

fret

  • v. 使烦恼，使焦急；
  • to be worried or unhappy and not able to relax
  • exp. Don’t fret; I’m sure your dog will be fine!
  • n. (斑卓琴、吉他、曼陀林琴等弦乐器指板上定音的) 档

rectify

  • v. 纠正；修复
  • to put right something that is wrong
  • exp. I made a mistake, so I quickly rectified it.

terrific

  • a. 极好的；可怕的；(尺寸或程度) 极其巨大的，大的惊人的
  • excellent; wonderful
  • exp. She feels terrific as she has successfully lost weight.

preceding

  • a. 在前的，在先的
  • to happen before something or come before something / somebody in order; to go in front of somebody
  • exp. Click this button to browse the preceding text.

cart

  • n. 手推车，运货马车；
  • exp. Carts are useful for carrying goods in the supermarket.
  • v. 用车装载

defer

  • v. 使推迟，使延期；
  • to delay something until a later time
  • exp. This country deferred the male citizens’ retirement age from 60 to 70.

wrench

  • n. 扳手；痛苦，难受；
  • a metal tool with a specially shaped end for holding and turning things, including one which can be adjusted to fit objects of different sizes, also called a monkey wrench or an adjustable spanner
  • exp. The worker used a wrench to repair the sink.
  • v. 使扭伤

comic

  • a. 滑稽的，喜剧的，漫画的；
  • amusing and making you laugh; connected with comedy (= entertainment that is funny and that makes people laugh)
  • exp. His comic actions often make us laugh.
  • n. 连环漫画杂志

entry.title: words_28
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/03/20

total 37 words

legitimate

  • a. 合法的；合理的；
  • allowed and acceptable according to the law
  • exp. Fishing is legitimate there.
  • vt. 使合法；授权；宣布···为合法

hamper

  • v. 阻碍，妨碍，牵制；
  • to prevent somebody from easily doing or achieving something
  • exp. This huge ball hampered the man’s progress on the obstacle course.
  • n. (有盖的) 大篮子

devise

  • v. 设计，想出；遗赠 (不动产)；
  • to invent something new or a new way of doing something
  • exp. They devised a plan for their company’s future.
  • n. 设计，发明，遗赠

pretext

  • n. 借口，托词
  • a false reason that you give for doing something usually something bad, in order to hide the real reason; an excuse
  • exp. The pupil asked for leave on the pretext of having a stomachache.

stale

  • a. 不新鲜的；走了味的；陈腐的；
  • (of food, especially bread and cake) no longer fresh and therefore unpleasant to eat
  • exp. There is a stale loaf of bread on the plate.
  • v. 变得不新鲜；使陈旧

desolate

  • a. 荒凉的；孤单寂寞的
  • (of a place) empty and without people, making you feel sad or frightened
  • exp. The landscape is desolate: nothing can survive there.

sieve

  • n. 筛子，粗篮；
  • to put something through a sieve
  • exp. The woman is sifting flour through the sieve.
  • v. 筛，滤

snatch

  • v. 强夺；攫取；
  • to take something quickly and often rudely or roughly
  • exp. My brother snatched my Barbie doll from my hands.
  • n. 片断

compatible

  • a. 可和谐共存的
  • able to exist together without trouble or conflict: going together well
  • exp. He is compatible with his friend because of their similar interests and opinions.
  • similar. compact
    • a. 小巧的，小型的，袖珍的，体积小的；紧密的，紧凑的，密集的
    • v. 把···压紧；变得坚实
    • n. 带镜小粉盒；合约，条约

eternal

  • a. 永恒的，永不改变的
  • without an end; existing or continuing forever
  • exp. The lock and key symbolize the eternal love of the couple.

revise

  • v. 修改；温习 (功课)
  • to change your opinions or plans, for example because of something you have learned; to change something, such as a book or an estimate, in order to correct or improve it
  • exp. Please revise your paper - it needs some corrctions and improvements.

deduce

  • v. 推论，腿短；演绎
  • to form an opinion about something based on the information or evidence that is available
  • exp. The detective deduced that the criminal is blonde and without one finger.

subdue

  • v. 征服，压制，减轻
  • to bring somebody / something under control, especially by using force; to calm or control your feelings
  • exp. The police subdue the criminal and pin him to the ground.

chronic

  • a. (疾病) 慢性的；长期的；(人) 久病的；积习难改的；严重的
  • (especially of a disease) lasting for a long time
  • exp. I suffer from chronic pain.

slack

  • a. 松弛的；懈怠的；萧条的；
  • not stretched tight
  • exp. It’s easier to walk across a slack rope than a tight one.
  • v. 变松弛，逃避工作

dread

  • v. 惧怕，害怕；
  • to be very afraid of something; to fear that something bad is going to happen
  • exp. The child dreads the ghost so much that he couldn’t fall asleep.
  • n. 畏惧，恐惧；
  • a. 恐怖的，使人敬畏的

refrain

  • v. 抑制，避免；
  • to stop yourself from doing something, especially something that you want to do
  • exp. Please refrain from talking on your cell phone in the theater.
  • n. 歌曲的反复句，叠句

earnest

  • a. 真诚的，诚挚的，认真的
  • very serious and sincere
  • exp. “Thank you very much!” said the granny with an earnest expression on her face.

clasp

  • v. 扣紧；握紧；扣住；抱紧；
  • to hold something tightly in your hand
  • exp. He clasped his hands together to pray.
  • n. 扣子；钩子；紧抱；紧握

enlighten

  • v. 启发，开导
  • to give somebody information so that they understand something better
  • exp. The teacher really enlightens his students.

feeble

  • a. 虚弱的
  • very weak; not effective; not showing determination or energy
  • exp. The feeble old man found it difficult to climb the stairs.

superb

  • a. 极好的；壮丽的
  • excellent; of very good quality
  • exp. Her piano performance is superb.

batter

  • n. (用鸡蛋、牛奶等调制的) 面糊；
  • a mixture of eggs, milk and flour used in cooking to cover food such as fish or chicken before you fry it, or to make pancakes; a mixture of eggs, milk, flour, etc. used for making cakes
  • exp. The mother is teaching her daughter how to make pancake batter.
  • v. 连续猛击

auxiliary

  • a. 备用的，辅助的，协助的
  • (of workers) giving help or support to the main group of workers; (of a piece of equipment) used if there is a problem with the main piece of equipment
  • exp. We have an auxiliary generator to deal with sudden black-outs.

take-away

  • phr. 外带，外卖
  • a restaurant that cooks and sells food that you take away and eat somewhere else
  • exp. I don’t want to eat the pizza here; I want some take-away.

nominal

  • a. 名义上的；象征性的，很少的；名词性的
  • being something in name only, and not in reality
  • exp. The emperor is just a nominal ruler.

conform

  • vi. 遵照，顺从；
  • to obey a rule, law, etc.
  • exp. Even the donkeys conform to traffic regulations!
  • vt. 使一致；
  • a. 一致的

wield

  • v. 挥；运用，行使
  • to hold something, ready to use it as a weapon or tool
  • exp. The warrior wields his two swords.

hose

  • n. 输水软管；
  • a long tube made of rubber, plastic, etc., used for putting water onto fires, gardens, etc.
  • exp. Fireman pointed the hose at the fire, hoping to put it out.
  • v. 用水管冲洗 (汽车等)

onset

  • n. 开始；攻击，袭击
  • the beginning of something, especially something unpleasant
  • exp. The referee’s whistle indicates the onset of the game.

porcelain

  • n. 瓷，瓷器；
  • a hard white shiny substance made by baking clay and used for making delicate cups, plates and decorative objects; objects that are made of this
  • exp. I use a porcelain pot to serve my tea.
  • a. 精美的

utility

  • n. 功用，用途，公用事业，物业；
  • a service provided for the public, for example an electricity, water or gas supply; (formal) the quality of being useful; a piece of computer software that performs a particular task
  • exp. A Swiss Army knife isn’t a thing of beauty, but it does have a lot of utility.
  • a. 通用性的

nursery

  • n. 托儿所
  • a place where children are cared for during the day while their parents are working
  • exp. I drop off my kids at the nursery before I go to work.

infringe

  • v. 侵犯，违反，侵害
  • (of an action, a plan, etc.) to break a law or rule
  • exp. This magazine article infringed on the privacy of the actress.

perverse

  • a. 违反常情的；邪恶的
  • showing deliberate determination to behave in a way that most people think is wrong, unacceptable or unreasonable
  • exp. The fish is being deliberately perverse to swim to an opposite direction.

recede

  • vi. 退去；渐渐远去；(尤指问题、感情或品质) 主键减弱；(头发) 从前向后减少；向后倾斜
  • to move gradually away from somebody or away from a previous position
  • exp. As he got older his hairline began to recede.

entry.title: words_27
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/03/19

total 22 words 1 opposite

stagnant

  • a. 不流动的
  • water or air is not moving and therefore smells unpleasant
  • exp. The pond looks very stagnant and probably doesn’t have fish.

clockwise

  • a. 顺时针方向的；
  • moving around in the same direction as the hands of a clock
  • exp. The man is walking around the garden in a clockwise direction.
  • adv. 顺时针方向地

elaborate

  • a. 精心设计的，精巧的；
  • very complicated and detailed; carefully prepared and orgnized
  • exp. The design of this church is very elaborate.
  • v. 详细说明，详尽阐述

subsequent

  • a. 随后的
  • happening or coming after something else
  • exp. Press this button to play the subsequent track.

concede

  • v. 承认失败；承认；让步
  • to admit that something is true, logical, etc.
  • exp. In the fight with this crazy kangaroo, I had no choice but to concede.

flank

  • n. 肋，肋腹，侧翼；
  • the side of an animal between the ribs and the hip; the side of something such as a building or mountain; the side of something such as a building or mountain; the left or right side of an army during a battle, or a sports team during a game
  • exp. Riders will dig their spurs into horses’ flanks in order to make them run faster.
  • v. 位于···的侧面

consolidate

  • v. 把···合为一体
  • to join things together into one; to be joined into one
  • exp. The two private taxi companies have been consolidated into one.

malnutrition

  • n. 营养不良
  • a poor condition of health caused by a lack of food or a lack of the right type of food
  • exp. The women suffering from malnutrition is very weak.

nuisance

  • n. 讨厌的人；麻烦事；伤害
  • a thing, person or situation that is annoying or cause trouble or problems
  • exp. The boy who keeps pulling the girl’s hair is really a nuisance!

spontaneous

  • a. 自发的，无意识的；自然的，天真率直的
  • not planned but done because you suddenly want to do it; often doing things without planning to, because you suddenly want to do them
  • exp. The father made a spontaneous decision to take his family to the beach that day.

baffle

  • v. 难住；使困惑；阻碍；
  • to confuse somebody completely; to be too difficult or strange for somebody to understand or explain
  • exp. The math problem really baffled him.
  • n. 挡住

intricate

  • a. 错综复杂的
  • having a lot of different parts and small details that fit together
  • exp. The inside of this watch is quite intricate.

bleak

  • a. 凄凉的；萧瑟的；阴郁的；无希望的
  • (of a place) exposed, empty, or with no pleasant features
  • exp. This place is so bleak and depressing.

eligible

  • a. 适合被选的，符合条件的；(尤指婚姻等) 合适的，合意的
  • a person who is eligible for something or to do something, is able to have or do it because they have the right qualifications, are the right age, etc.
  • exp. In China, you are eligible to get your driver license as early as 18.

partial

  • a. 不完全的；偏爱的，特别喜欢的；偏袒的，不公平的，有偏见的；部分的
  • showing or feeling too much support for one person, tam, idea, etc., in away that is unfair
  • exp. The partial eclipse obscured less than half the moon’s surface.
  • opposite. impartial
  • a. 公平的，不偏不倚的

segment

  • n. 部分；片段；(橘子等的) 瓣
  • a part of something that is separate from the other parts or can be considered separately
  • exp. Our company dominates a small segment of the market.

afflict

  • v. 使痛苦；使苦恼
  • to affect somebody / something in an unpleasant or harmful way
  • exp. She is afflicted by a bad headache.

adverse

  • a. 不利的；(方向上) 逆的；在相反的方向上移动 (或运转)； 相反的
  • negative and unpleasant; not likely to produce a good result
  • exp. Bad teeth are one of the adverse effects of drinking too many carbonated beverages.

outlet

  • n. 出口；表现机会，发泄方法
  • a pipe or hole through which liquid or gas can flow out
  • exp. Water came out of the wall through several outlets.

surpass

  • v. 胜出；超出
  • to do or be better than somebody / something
  • exp. The turtle surpassed the rabbit in the running race.

cater

  • v. 供应伙食；为 (集会、婚礼等) 承办酒席
  • to provide food and drinks for a social event
  • exp. We are able to cater for weddings, parties and banquets.

entry.title: words_26
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/03/18

total 17 words 1 opposite

precipitate

  • a. 突如其来的，仓促的，迅猛的；
  • to suddenly force somebody / something into a particular state or condition
  • exp. They did not expect the rain to be precipitate as quickly as it did.
  • v. 【气象】凝结；促成，使···沉淀，猛摔；
  • n. 沉淀物，冷凝物

detach

  • v. 使分开，拆卸
  • to remove something from something larger; to become separated from something; to leave or separate yourself from somebody / something
  • exp. I detach the screen protector from my phone.
  • opposite. attach

lapse

  • n. 失误，过失；(时间) 流逝；
  • a small mistake, especially one that is caused by forgetting something or by being careless
  • exp. I had a lapse in judgment and put too much soap in the laundry.
  • v. 背弃，放弃 (宗教信仰)

ascertain

  • v. 探知，弄清，查明 (真相等)
  • to find out the true or correct information about something
  • exp. The detective searched this room to ascertain the facts of the case.

disclose

  • v. 公开，揭露，泄露
  • to make (something) known to the public
  • exp. He disclosed the classified secret to the public

pastime

  • n. 消遣，娱乐
  • something that you enjoy doing when you are not working
  • exp. Reading is my favorite pastime.

hectic

  • a. 紧张的，忙碌的，患肺病的，(因患肺病等) 发烧的，有病态潮红的脸上发红，发热的，兴奋的，狂热的，肺病的
  • very busy and filled with activity
  • exp. She hopes to have more hands to end this hectic day!

lofty

  • a. 极高的，巍峨的
  • (of buildings, mountains, etc.) very high and impressive
  • exp. This mountain’s lofty peak towers through the clouds.

strenuous

  • a. 费力的
  • needing great effort and energy
  • exp. It’s a strenuous thing for him to raise the weights.

conceal

  • v. 隐藏，隐瞒，掩盖
  • to hide somebody / something
  • exp. I use this mask to conceal my face.

foil

  • n. 锡箔纸；衬托；
  • metal made into very thin sheets that is used for covering or wrapping things, especially food
  • exp. The dark chocolate cakes in foil cups are put on the table.
  • v. 挫败；使受挫折

hoist

  • v. 升起，吊起；向上推；
  • to raise or pull something up to a higher position, often using ropes or special equipment
  • exp. We use the machine to hoist the huge stone off the ground.
  • n. 起重机

shrewd

  • a. 精明的；机灵的
  • clever at understanding and making judgements about a situation
  • exp. He was a shrewd businessman who was careful with every penny.

consecutive

  • a. 连续的，连贯的
  • following one after another in a series, without interruption
  • exp. She has been the top student in her class for three consecutive years.

deceive

  • v. 欺骗，行骗
  • to make (someone) believe something that is not true
  • exp. The man deceives others by wearing a hilarious mask.

elite

  • n. 精英
  • a small group of people in a society, etc. who are powerful and have a lot of influence, because they are rich, intelligent, etc.
  • exp. Only a few elites can make it to the top of the pyramid.

circumference

  • n. 圆周长度，圆周；周围
  • the length of a line that goes around something or that makes a circle or other round shape; the external boundary or surface of a figure or object
  • exp. Can you measure the circumference of this apple?

entry.title: words_25
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/03/17

total 25 words

errand

  • n. 差事；差使；使命
  • a job that you do for somebody that involves going somewhere to take a message, to buy something, deliver goods, etc.
  • exp. In many companies, interns run boring errands for their bosses.

frail

  • a. 脆弱的，不坚实的
  • (especially of an old person) physically weak and thin; weak; easily damaged or broken
  • exp. The frail old lady needs a walking stick to walk.

inferior

  • a. (等级、地位等) 下等的，低等的；低劣的；
  • (formal) of lower rank; lower
  • exp. He makes me fell I’m inferior to him.
  • n. 部下，地位低的人；次品

chamber

  • n. 会议室
  • a hall in a public building that is used for formal meetings
  • exp. The chamber has enough seats for a meeting.

peel

  • v. 剥皮，削皮，去壳；
  • exp. You must peel the banana before you eat it.
  • n. 果皮，外皮

unanimous

  • a. 一致同意的；全体一致的
  • if a decision or an opinion is unanimous, it is agreed or shared by everyone in a group
  • exp. There was unanimous agreement that we should do the business deal.

exemplify

  • v. 举例说明；例示，是···的典范
  • to give an example in order to make something clearer
  • exp. The teacher uses her gesture to exemplify the pronunciations in English.

endorse

  • v. 代言
  • to say in an advertisement that you use and like a particular product so that other people will want to buy it
  • exp. The celebrity is endorsing the brand’s lipstick.

deduct

  • v. 减去
  • to take away money, points, etc. from a total amount
  • exp. Two points will be deducted for a wrong answer.

irony

  • n. 具有讽刺意味的事；反语；冷嘲
  • the amusing or strange aspect of a situation that is very different from what you expect; a situation like this
  • exp. I slipped right next to the “do not slip” sign, and we all laughed at the irony.

likewise

  • adv. 同样地，此外
  • the same; in a similar way; also
  • exp. The big man hates the small man; likewise, the small man hates the big man.

cellar

  • n. 酒窖；地窖；地下室
  • an underground room where wine is stored; the wine stored in this room
  • exp. The cellar is filled with wine barrels.

cradle

  • n. 摇篮；策源地，发源地；
  • a small bed for a baby which can be pushed gently from side to side
  • exp. The adorable baby is lying in the cradle.
  • v. 轻轻地抱，捧

reciprocal

  • a. 相互的，互惠的
  • involving two people or groups who agree to help each other or behave in the same way to each other
  • exp. Reciprocal relationships contribute to a good neighborhood.
    互惠关系有助于建立好的邻里感情。

incorporate

  • v. 包含；使并入
  • exp. The app update incorporates many new features and improvements.

allege

  • v. 断言；硬说
  • to state something as a fact but without giving proof
  • exp. Some people allege that these red envelopes were given by Cantonese people.

pertinent

  • a. 有关的；适当的；中肯的
  • appropriate to a particular situation
  • exp. I collected pertinent information of France before I traveled there.

booth

  • n. 有篷的售货摊；小舍；隔开的小间；公用电话亭；窝棚
  • a small confined place where you can do something privately, for example make a telephone call, or vote
  • exp. I buy a piece of pancake from the booth every morning.

remedy

  • v. 治疗；恢复；补救；
  • to relieve or cure (a disease, illness, etc.) by or as if by a remedy
  • exp. The liar claimed that his medicine can remedy all diseases.
  • n. 治疗；补救；矫正

glitter

  • v. 闪闪发光，闪耀；
  • to shine brightly with little flashes of light, like a diamond; (of the eyes) to shine brightly with a particular emotion, usually a strong one
  • exp. Look at the crystal chandelier glittering. It’s so beautiful!
  • n. 灿烂的光辉，闪光

synthetic

  • a. 合成的，人造的；
  • artificial; made by combining chemical substances rather than being produced naturally by plants or animals
  • exp. These fibers are synthetic.
  • n. 合成物

comprise

  • v. 构成；包含，包括
  • to have somebody / something as parts or members
  • exp. These animals comprise most of the cat family.

inflict

  • v. 使遭受 (损伤、痛苦等)
  • to make somebody / something suffer something unpleasant
  • exp. His illness inflicted sharp pain on his stomach.

weld

  • v. 焊接；使接合，使成整体；
  • to join pieces of metal together by heating their edges and pressing them together
  • exp. He is welding together the two pieces of metal.
  • n. 焊接

yacht

  • n. 游艇；帆船
  • a large sailing boat, often also with an engine and a place to sleep on board, used for pleasure trips and racing
  • exp. Let’s take our yacht out on the ocean today.

entry.title: words_24
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/03/16

total 18 words

superfluous

  • a. 多余的，过剩的
  • more than you need or want
  • exp. It is superfluous to add feet to the snake while painting.

ore

  • n. 矿，矿石；矿砂
  • rock, earth, etc. from which metal can be obtained
  • exp. These beautiful ores are the material

dilute

  • v. 使变淡，稀释；使病弱
  • to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid to it
  • exp. Water dilutes the solution quickly.

propaganda

  • n. 宣传；宣传方法
  • ideas or statements that may be false or exaggerated and that are used in order to gain support for a political leader, party, etc.
  • exp. The political propaganda is posted onto the lampposts around the city.

contemporary

  • a. 当代的，现代的；同时代的；
  • belonging to the present time
  • exp. As a contemporary writer, his books appealed more to a youthful audience.
  • n. 同龄人，同时代的人

vocational

  • a. 职业的；业务的
  • connected with the skills, knowledge, etc. that you need to have in order to do a particular job
  • exp. I learned how to drive this in vocational school.

clutch

  • v. 紧握；抓住；
  • to hold somebody / something tightly
  • exp. He clutches his red packet and stays alert.
  • n. 抓住；离合器

grope

  • v. 摸索，探索，动手动脚
  • to try and find something that you cannot see, by feeling with your hands; to try and reach a place by feeling with your hands because you cannot see clearly; to touch somebody sexually, especially when they do not want you to
  • exp. “Is anybody there?” he asked as he groped for the light switch.

erosion

  • n. 侵蚀；磨损；削弱；减少
  • the process by which the surface of something is gradually destroyed through the action of wind, rain, etc.
  • exp. The strange shape of the rock was caused by wind erosion.

brittle

  • a. 易碎的；脆弱的；靠不住的
  • hard but easily broken
  • exp. The wine glass looks brittle. Use it carefully!

oust

  • v. 罢免，驱逐，剥夺，取代
  • to force somebody out of a job or position of power, especially in order to take their place
  • exp. The traitor was ousted from the group.

agitation

  • n. 焦虑，忧虑；摇动
  • worry and anxiety that you show by behaving in a nervous way
  • exp. Apparently she is in a state of agitation.

drastic

  • a. 极端的；猛烈的；激烈的
  • extreme in a way that has a sudden, serious or violent effect on something
  • exp. The weather changes are so drastic and unpredictable.

glossary

  • n. 词汇表，术语汇编
  • a list of technical or special words, especially those in a particular text, explaining their meanings
  • exp. You should preview the new words in the glossary before going to class.

aggregate

  • n. 合计；总数；
  • a total number or amount made up of smaller amounts that are collected together
  • exp. The player earned an aggregate of $48000000 from sponsorship deals.
  • a. 总的，总数的；
  • v. 集合

cavity

  • n. 龋洞
  • a hole in a tooth
  • exp. Mr. Tooth is in a great deal of pain due to the cavity on his body.

choir

  • n. (教会的) 歌唱队，唱诗班
  • a group of people who sing together, for example in church services or public performances
  • exp. A penguin choir sings Christmas songs.

yoke

  • n. 牛轭；枷锁；纽带；
  • a long piece of wood that is fastened across the necks of two animals, especially oxen, so that they can pull heavy loads
  • exp. The two oxen are attached together by a yoke over their necks.

entry.title: words_23
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/03/15

total 23 words 2 similar

practitioner

  • n. (医生或律师等) 开业者；实践者，从事者
  • a person who works in a profession, especially medicine or law
  • exp. A medical practitioner comforts the woman.

radical

  • n. 激进分子；
  • a person with radical opinions
  • exp. Some radicals insist that every animal should eat grass.
  • a. 激进的；重大的，彻底的

merit

  • n. 优点；价值；

  • exp. A merit of this phone is that the excellent camera can clearly capture the moon. (指华为P30)
  • v. 值得；应得；
  • n. 功绩

commend

  • v. 称赞；委托保管
  • to praise somebody / something, especially publicly
  • exp. The worker was highly commended for his hard work.
  • similar command

plunder

  • v. 抢劫，掠夺；
  • to steal things from a place, especially using force during a time of war
  • exp. A burglar broke in and plundered my house.
  • n. 抢劫，战利品

facilitate

  • v. 为他人提供方便；使便利；
  • to make an action or a process possible or easier
  • exp. The machine facilitates her ability to go places by herself.
  • vt. 促进

propagate

  • vt. 传播，宣传；
  • to spread an idea, a belief or a piece of information among many people
  • exp. We want to propagate our company’s influence across the world.
  • v. 繁殖，增殖

jury

  • n. 陪审团；全体评审员，评判委员会
  • a group of members of the public who listen to the facts of a case in a court and decide whether or not somebody is guilty of a crime
  • exp. The lawyer is showing the evidence to the jury.

reel

  • n. 卷盘；
  • a round object around which you wind such things as thread, wire or film; a reel together with the film, wire, thread, etc. that is wound around it
  • exp. Movies used to be stored on reels of film; now, they’re on hard drives.
  • v. 感到震惊；眩晕；旋转

verge

  • n. 边缘；边界；
  • (British English) a piece of grass at the edge of a path, road, etc.
  • exp. The verge of the road is covered with lovely blue flowers.
  • v. 接近；濒临

masculine

  • a. 男子气概的
  • of or belonging to the class of words (called a gender) that ordinarily includes most of the words referring to males
  • exp. His beard and suit are masculine enough to show his charm.

cue

  • n. 球杆；
  • an action or event that is a signal for somebody to do something
  • exp. While playing billiards, you should hit the ball with a cue.
    打台球时，你要用球杆去击球。
  • v. 给···提示

gown

  • n. 女礼服；女裙服；长袍
  • a woman’s dress, especially a long one for special occasions
  • exp. The bride wore aa beautiful white wedding gown.

curb

  • v. 勒住；抑制；控制；约束；
  • to control or limit something, especially something bad
  • exp. Curb your horse now before it runs off the cliff!
  • n. 路缘；控制；约束

juvenile

  • n. 青少年；雏鸟；
  • a young person who is not yet an addult
  • exp. This group of juveniles are taking a selfie together.
  • a. 青少年的；幼稚的

susceptible

  • a. 易受感染的；易受影响的；多情的
  • very likely to be influenced, harmed or affected by somebody / something
  • exp. Young children are susceptible to disease.

discrepancy

  • n. 不一致，差异，不符
  • a difference between two or more things that should be the same
  • exp. There is a noticeable discrepancy between the photo of the cake and the actual one.

formidable

  • a. 令人畏惧的；可怕的；难以克服的
  • if people, things or situations are formidable, you feel fear and / or respect for them, because they are impressive or powerful, or because they seem very difficult
  • exp. In ping-pong competition tournament, he was a formidable opponent.

converge

  • v. (向某一点) 相交，会合
  • (of two or more lines, paths, etc.) to move towards each other and meet at a point

latitude

  • n. 纬度；(言论，行动的) 自由

blend

  • v. 混合；把···混合一体；
  • to mix two or more substances together
  • exp. Blend the flour and the water with a spoon.
  • n. 混合物

stationery

  • n. 文具；(有配套信封的) 信纸

  • exp. You can buy this nicely designed stationery from our online store.
  • similar stationary
    • a. 静止的；固定的
    • n. 定居者，驻军

entry.title: words_22
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/03/14

total 20 words

fixture

  • n. 固定装置
  • a thing such as a bath / bathtub or a toilet that is fixed in a house and that you do not take with you when you move house
  • exp. The light fixture is being installed.

poultry

  • n. 家禽(肉)
  • chickens, ducks and geese, kept for their meat or eggs; meat from chickens, ducks and geese
  • exp. Farmers keep poultry, such as chickens and ducks, for their meat and eggs.

alloy

  • n. 合金；

  • exp. We used a strong alloy for the blades of the engine.
  • v. 使成合金

meadow

  • n. 草地
  • a field covered in grass, used especially for hay
  • exp. There are a flock of sheep wandering around the meadow.

  • n. 阵风，(感情的) 迸发，汹涌
  • a sudden strong increase in the amount and speed of wind that is blowing; a sudden strong expression of emotion
  • exp. The gust of wind almost blew her away.

toxic

  • a. 有毒的；
  • containing poison; poisonous
  • exp. The air is toxic; Don’t breathe it.
  • n. 毒物

garment

  • n. 服装
  • a piece of clothing
  • exp. Which garment should I choose to wear today?

redundant

  • a. 多余的，过剩的
  • not needed or useful
  • exp. The old steam train is redundant and has been replaced with newer trains.

  • /ˌpænə’ræmə/

  • a view of a wide area of land; a description, study or set of pictures that presents all the different aspects or stages of a particular subject, event, etc.
  • exp. This panorama shows the entire downtown skyline.

nurture

  • to care for and protect somebody / something while they are growing and developing
  • exp. The plant needs to be carefully nurtured with water and fertilizer.

repent

  • v. 悔改；后悔
  • to feel or show that you are sorry for something bad or wrong that you did
  • exp. He repents his stupid decision.

whip

  • vt. 鞭打，抽打；
  • to hit a person or an animal hard with a whip, as a punishment or to make them go faster or work harder
  • exp. The guy whips his horses to make them run faster.
  • n. 组织秘书；
  • v. 一下子猛地移动，急走，急冲

judicial

  • a. 司法的，法庭的，法律的，审判 (上) 的
  • connected with a court, a judge or legal judgement
  • exp. The judge, jury and witnesses are important participants in the judicial system.

grumble

  • v. 发牢骚；
  • to complain about somebody / something in a bad-tempered way; to make a deep continuous sound

  • n. 参考书目；文献学

vicinity

  • n. 附近地区；近邻
  • the area around a particular place
  • exp. These houses are in the vicinity of the hospital.

intrigue

  • exp. An evil intrigue suddenly comes to his mind.

bust

  • n. 半身塑像；胸部；

  • exp. The bust of Pythagoras honors the great Greek mathematician.
  • v. 打碎；搜捕；降级；终止；
  • a. 破产的；打碎的

porch

  • n. 门廊；走廊
  • a small area at the entrance to a building, such as a house or a church, that is covered by a roof and often has walls; a platform with an open front and a roof, built onto the side of a house on the ground floor
  • exp. I love to sit on the front porch and feel the wind.

entry.title: words_21
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/03/13

total 17 words

remnant

  • n. 遗迹；边角剩料
  • a part of something that is left after the other parts have been used, removed, destroyed, etc.
  • exp. The remnant of Yuanmingyuan becomes a tourist attraction today.

  • a. 占主导地位的；显著的
  • having more power or influence than others
  • exp. The white pieces were predominant on the chess board, so I lost the game.

barter

  • v. 物物交换；以货易货
  • to exchange goods, property, services, etc. for other goods, etc. without using money
  • exp. He bartered the fruits for the rabbit.

drudgery

  • n. 苦工，苦差事，单调乏味的工作
  • boring, difficult, or unpleasant work
  • exp. I hate my job - it’s just a bunch of mindless drudgery.

come round (around)

  • phr. 改变主意；重又来到
  • change one’s position or opinion
  • exp. I thought he’d never agree, but in the end he came around.

terraces

  • n. 梯田
  • a flat, hard area, especially outside a house or restaurant, where you can sit, eat and enjoy the sun
  • exp. This area is famous for its beautiful rice terraces.

zoology

  • n. 动物学；动物区系
  • the branch of science that involves that study of animals and animal behavior
  • exp. The boy is reading a book about zoology.

crude

  • n. 原油；
  • oil in its natural state, before it has been treated with chemicals
  • exp. The middle east is rich in crude oil.
  • a. 天然的；粗糙的；粗鲁的；简陋的

stand off

  • phr. 远离；疏远
  • the act of repulsing or repelling an attack; a successful defensive stand
  • exp. They’ve been arguing for hours, and there’s no sign the stand off will end.

counterbalance

  • v. 使平衡；抵消；
  • to have an equal but opposite effect to something else
  • exp. Add some honey to counterbalance the acidity of the lemon.
  • n. 抵销

wardrobe

  • n. 衣橱；全部服装
  • a large cupboard for hanging clothes in which is either a piece of furniture or (in British English) built into the wall
  • exp. All my clothes are in this wardrobe.

opening

  • n. 开口；孔；开始；开幕；职位空缺
  • a space or hole that somebody / something can pass through
  • exp. There’s a small opening near the back; we can exit there.

nuance

  • n. 细微差别
  • a very small difference in color, tone, meaning, etc.
  • exp. There are some nuances in appearance of the twin sisters.

explicit

  • a. 充分表达清楚的，明确的
  • (of a statement or piece of writing) clear and easy to understand
  • exp. The map shows an explicit route to me.

shiver

  • v. 颤抖，打战；颤动；
  • (of a person) to shake slightly because you are cold, frightened, exicited, etc.
  • exp. The man’s hand is shivering violently.
  • n. 颤抖，打战

appraisal

  • n. 评估；估价；评价
  • a judgement of the value, performance or nature of somebody / something
  • exp. His appraisal of the house shows that it isn’t very valuable.

make for sb.(sth.)

  • phr. 有助于
  • cause to happen or to occur as a consequence
  • exp. Fresh vegetable makes for your health.

entry.title: words_20
entry.content:
百词斩 雅思 2020/03/12

total 29 words

overhaul

  • n. 大修；彻底革新；
  • an examination of a machine or system, including doing repairs on it or making changes to it
  • exp. This bathroom needs a major overhaul.

paranoia

  • n. (心理) 偏执狂，多疑症
  • exp. The man suffers from paranoia; he believes others are trying to harm him.

fatuous

  • a. 愚昧而不自知的
  • foolish or stupid

equivalent

  • a. 相等的；等值的；
  • equal in value, amount, meaning, importance, etc.
  • exp. The price of the luxury car is equivalent to ten times his annual salary.
  • n. 同义词；等价物

scrupulous

  • a. 小心谨慎的，严谨的，细心的
  • very careful about doing something correctly
  • exp. The player looks scrupulous when he adjusts his position to hit the ball.

take sth. in

  • v. 改小尺寸；领会
  • know and comprehend the nature or meaning of
  • exp. The girl has to take in her dress a little to make it fit better.

excavate

  • v. 挖掘，挖出
  • to dig in the ground to look for old buildings or objects that have been buried for a long time; to find something by digging in this way
  • exp. This machine is excavating the ground.

haul

  • v. 拖，拉，拽；
  • to pull something / somebody with a lot of effort
  • exp. It is pointless for him to attempt to haul the truck barehanded.
  • n. 一次获得；
  • v. 硬拖，硬拉，用力拖

convene

  • v. 集合，召集，召唤
  • to arrange for people to come together for a formal meeting; to come together for a formal meeting
  • exp. We convened at the coffee shop.

pinpoint

  • v. 准确地解释或说明；
  • to find and show the exact position of somebody / something or the exact time that something happened; to be able to give the exact reason for something or to describe something exactly
  • exp. I pinpointed the enemy’s position with the flag.
  • a. 精确地；
  • n. 针尖，极小之物，极不重要的食物

retort

  • v. 反驳

  • n. 反驳，反击，回嘴

pass sth. on to

  • v. 把···交给···
  • place into the hands or custody of
  • exp. She passed her old bracelet on to her daughter.

mercantile

  • a. 商人的，商业的
  • of or relating to the business of buying and selling products to earn money : of or relating to trade or merchants
  • exp. This is a mercantile container used for trading.

mannerism

  • n. (说话、举止等的) 习气，癖性，矫揉造作

  • exp. One of the girl’s mannerisms is to bite her own toe.

tonic

  • n. 补药，主调音或基音；

  • a. 滋补的，声调的，使精神振作的

look in (on sb.)

  • v. (顺便) 看望
  • go to see in passing

bring (call) sth. to mind

  • v. 想起某事
  • remind sb of doing sth
  • exp. Your words bring something to mind.

petition

  • n. 请愿书；祈求；
  • a written document signed by a large number of people that asks somebody in a position of authority to do or change something
  • exp. The villagers signed a petition asking for a new school.
  • v. 情愿

dodge

  • v. 躲避，避开；
  • to move quickly and suddenly to one side in order to avoid somebody / something
  • exp. Wow, look at him dodge all those bullets!
  • n. 躲闪，躲避；
  • v. 回避，规避

secretion

  • n. 分泌，分泌物，隐藏
  • the production of a liquid by part of a plant or animal

laudable

  • a. 值得称赞的
  • deserving praise
  • exp. Her performance was laudable: everybody loved it.

pay sb. back

  • v. 受到惩罚
  • do or give something to somebody in return

intersection

  • n. 交点，十字路口
  • a place where two or more roads, lines, etc. meet or cross each other; the act of intersecting something

ascribe

  • v. 把···归因于；把···归属于

ruinous

  • a. 毁坏的，毁灭性的，破坏性的
